items.js

Summary
items.js
ItemSuperclass for all visible objects (TabItems and GroupItems).
Variables
isAnItemAlways true for Items
boundsThe position and size of this Item, represented as a <Rect>.
zIndexThe z-index for this item.
debugWhen set to true, displays a rectangle on the screen that corresponds with bounds.
$debugIf debug is true, this will be the iQ object for the visible rectangle.
containerThe outermost DOM element that describes this item on screen.
lockedAffects whether an item can be pushed, closed, renamed, etc
parentThe groupItem that this item is a child of
userSizeA <Point> that describes the last size specifically chosen by the user.
dragOptionsUsed by draggable
dropOptionsUsed by draggable if the item is set to droppable.
resizeOptionsUsed by resizable
isDraggingBoolean for whether the item is currently being dragged or not.
Functions
_initInitializes the object.
dropAcceptFunctionGiven a DOM element, returns true if it should accept tabs being dropped on it.
getBoundsReturns a copy of the Item’s bounds as a <Rect>.
overlapsWithOtherItemsReturns true if this Item overlaps with any other Item on the screen.
setPositionMoves the Item to the specified location.
setSizeResizes the Item to the specified size.
setUserSizeRemembers the current size as one the user has chosen.
getZReturns the zIndex of the Item.
setRotationRotates the object to the given number of degrees.
setParentSets the receiver’s parent to the given Item.
pushAwayPushes all other items away so none overlap this Item.
_updateDebugBoundsCalled by a subclass when its bounds change, to update the debugging rectangles on screen.
setTrenchesSets up/moves the trenches for snapping to this item.
removeTrenchesRemoves the trenches for snapping to this item.
snapThe snap function used during groupItem creation via drag-out
draggableEnables dragging on this item.
droppableEnables or disables dropping on this item.
resizableEnables or disables resizing of this item.
ItemsKeeps track of all Items.
Variables
defaultGutterHow far apart Items should be from each other and from bounds
Functions
itemGiven a DOM element representing an Item, returns the Item.
getTopLevelItemsReturns an array of all Items not grouped into groupItems.
getPageBoundsReturns a <Rect> defining the area of the page Items should stay within.
getSafeWindowBoundsReturns the bounds within which it is safe to place all non-stationary Items.
arrangeArranges the given items in a grid within the given bounds, maximizing item size but maintaining standard tab aspect ratio for each
unsquishChecks to see which items can now be unsquished.

Item

Superclass for all visible objects (TabItems and GroupItems).

If you subclass, in addition to the things Item provides, you need to also provide these methods

setBoundsfunction(rect, immediately)
setZfunction(value)
closefunction()
savefunction()

Subclasses of Item must also provide the <Subscribable> interface.

... and this property

defaultSizea Point
lockedan object (see below)

Make sure to call _init() from your subclass’s constructor.

Variables

isAnItem

this.isAnItem

Always true for Items

bounds

this.bounds

The position and size of this Item, represented as a <Rect>.

zIndex

this.zIndex

The z-index for this item.

debug

this.debug

When set to true, displays a rectangle on the screen that corresponds with bounds.  May be used for additional debugging features in the future.

$debug

this.$debug

If debug is true, this will be the iQ object for the visible rectangle.

container

this.container

The outermost DOM element that describes this item on screen.

locked

this.locked

Affects whether an item can be pushed, closed, renamed, etc

The object may have properties to specify what can’t be changed

.boundstrue if it can’t be pushed, dragged, resized, etc
.closetrue if it can’t be closed
.titletrue if it can’t be renamed

parent

this.parent

The groupItem that this item is a child of

userSize

this.userSize

A <Point> that describes the last size specifically chosen by the user.  Used by unsquish.

dragOptions

this.dragOptions

Used by draggable

Possible properties

cancelClassA space-delimited list of classes that should cancel a drag
startA function to be called when a drag starts
dragA function to be called each time the mouse moves during drag
stopA function to be called when the drag is done

dropOptions

this.dropOptions

Used by draggable if the item is set to droppable.

Possible properties

acceptA function to determine if a particular item should be accepted for dropping
overA function to be called when an item is over this item
outA function to be called when an item leaves this item
dropA function to be called when an item is dropped in this item

resizeOptions

this.resizeOptions

Used by resizable

Possible properties

minWidthMinimum width allowable during resize
minHeightMinimum height allowable during resize
aspectRatiotrue if we should respect aspect ratio; default false
startA function to be called when resizing starts
resizeA function to be called each time the mouse moves during resize
stopA function to be called when the resize is done

isDragging

this.isDragging

Boolean for whether the item is currently being dragged or not.

Functions

_init

_init: function Item__init(container)

Initializes the object.  To be called from the subclass’s intialization function.

Parameters

containerthe outermost DOM element that describes this item onscreen.

dropAcceptFunction

accept: function dropAcceptFunction(item)

Given a DOM element, returns true if it should accept tabs being dropped on it.  Private to this file.

getBounds

getBounds: function Item_getBounds()

Returns a copy of the Item’s bounds as a <Rect>.

overlapsWithOtherItems

overlapsWithOtherItems: function Item_overlapsWithOtherItems()

Returns true if this Item overlaps with any other Item on the screen.

setPosition

setPosition: function Item_setPosition(left,
top,
immediately)

Moves the Item to the specified location.

Parameters

leftthe new left coordinate relative to the window
topthe new top coordinate relative to the window
immediatelyif false or omitted, animates to the new position; otherwise goes there immediately

setSize

setSize: function Item_setSize(width,
height,
immediately)

Resizes the Item to the specified size.

Parameters

widththe new width in pixels
heightthe new height in pixels
immediatelyif false or omitted, animates to the new size; otherwise resizes immediately

setUserSize

setUserSize: function Item_setUserSize()

Remembers the current size as one the user has chosen.

getZ

getZ: function Item_getZ()

Returns the zIndex of the Item.

setRotation

setRotation: function Item_setRotation(degrees)

Rotates the object to the given number of degrees.

setParent

setParent: function Item_setParent(parent)

Sets the receiver’s parent to the given Item.

pushAway

pushAway: function Item_pushAway()

Pushes all other items away so none overlap this Item.

_updateDebugBounds

_updateDebugBounds: function Item__updateDebugBounds()

Called by a subclass when its bounds change, to update the debugging rectangles on screen.  This functionality is enabled only by the debug property.

setTrenches

setTrenches: function Item_setTrenches(rect)

Sets up/moves the trenches for snapping to this item.

removeTrenches

removeTrenches: function Item_removeTrenches()

Removes the trenches for snapping to this item.

snap

snap: function Item_snap()

The snap function used during groupItem creation via drag-out

draggable

draggable: function Item_draggable()

Enables dragging on this item.  Note: not to be called multiple times on the same item!

droppable

droppable: function Item_droppable(value)

Enables or disables dropping on this item.

resizable

resizable: function Item_resizable(value)

Enables or disables resizing of this item.

Items

Keeps track of all Items.

Summary
Variables
defaultGutterHow far apart Items should be from each other and from bounds
Functions
itemGiven a DOM element representing an Item, returns the Item.
getTopLevelItemsReturns an array of all Items not grouped into groupItems.
getPageBoundsReturns a <Rect> defining the area of the page Items should stay within.
getSafeWindowBoundsReturns the bounds within which it is safe to place all non-stationary Items.
arrangeArranges the given items in a grid within the given bounds, maximizing item size but maintaining standard tab aspect ratio for each
unsquishChecks to see which items can now be unsquished.

Variables

defaultGutter

How far apart Items should be from each other and from bounds

Functions

item

item: function Items_item(el)

Given a DOM element representing an Item, returns the Item.

getTopLevelItems

getTopLevelItems: function Items_getTopLevelItems()

Returns an array of all Items not grouped into groupItems.

getPageBounds

getPageBounds: function Items_getPageBounds()

Returns a <Rect> defining the area of the page Items should stay within.

getSafeWindowBounds

getSafeWindowBounds: function Items_getSafeWindowBounds()

Returns the bounds within which it is safe to place all non-stationary Items.

arrange

arrange: function Items_arrange(items,
bounds,
options)

Arranges the given items in a grid within the given bounds, maximizing item size but maintaining standard tab aspect ratio for each

Parameters

itemsan array of Items.  Can be null if the pretend and count options are set.
boundsa <Rect> defining the space to arrange within
optionsan object with various properites (see below)

Possible “options” properties

animatewhether to animate; default: true.
zthe z index to set all the items; default: don’t change z.
pretendwhether to collect and return the rectangle rather than moving the items; default: false
countoverrides the item count for layout purposes; default: the actual item count
paddingpixels between each item

Returns

the list of rectangles if the pretend option is set; otherwise null

unsquish

unsquish: function Items_unsquish(pairs,
ignore)

Checks to see which items can now be unsquished.

Parameters

pairsan array of objects, each with two properties: item and bounds.  The bounds are modified as appropriate, but the items are not changed.  If pairs is null, the operation is performed directly on all of the top level items.
ignorean Item to not include in calculations (because it’s about to be closed, for instance)

Variables
An Item that represents a tab.
A single groupItem in the TabView window.
